Home > misc > dist > stk_dist.m

stk_dist

PURPOSE

STK_DIST computes a matrix of (Euclidean) distances

SYNOPSIS

function D = stk_dist(x, y, pairwise)

DESCRIPTION 

 STK_DIST computes a matrix of (Euclidean) distances

 CALL: D = stk_dist(X, Y)

    computes the matrix of distances between X and Y. More precisely, if
    X is an nX x d matrix, and Y an nY x d matrix, the D is an nX x nY
    matrix with

       D_{i,j} = norm(X(i,:) - Y(j,:)),

    where norm(.) denotes the Euclidean norm in R^d.

 See also: stk_mindist, norm

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

0042 function D = stk_dist(x, y, pairwise)
0043 stk_narginchk(1, 3);
0044 
0045 % read argument #1
0046 if isstruct(x),
0047     x = x.a;
0048 end
0049 
0050 % read argument #2
0051 if nargin < 2,
0052     y = [];
0053 else
0054     if isstruct(y),
0055         y = y.a;
0056     end
0057 end
0058 
0059 % read argument #3
0060 if nargin < 3,
0061     pairwise = false;
0062 else
0063     if ~islogical(pairwise)
0064         errmsg = 'Argument ''pairwise'' should be either true or false.';
0065         stk_error(errmsg, 'TypeMismatch');
0066     end
0067 end
0068 
0069 if pairwise,
0070     if isempty(y),
0071         D = zeros(size(x, 1), 1);
0072     else
0073         D = stk_dist_pairwise(x, y);
0074     end
0075 else
0076     if isempty(y),
0077         D = stk_dist_matrixx(x);
0078     else
0079         D = stk_dist_matrixy(x, y);
0080     end
0081 end
0082 
0083 end % function stk_dist
0084 
0085 %%
0086 % Check that an error is raised in nargin is not either 1 or 2
0087 
0088 %!error stk_dist();
0089 %!error stk_dist(0, 0, 0);
0090 %!error stk_dist(0, 0, 0, 0);
0091 
0092 %%
0093 % Check that an error is raised when the number of columns differs
0094 
0095 %!error stk_dist(0, ones(1, 2));
0096 %!error stk_dist(eye(3), ones(1, 2));
0097 %!error stk_dist(ones(2, 1), zeros(2));
0098 
0099 %%
0100 % Check that ".a" structures are accepted
0101 
0102 %!test
0103 %! d = 3; x = rand(7, d); y = rand(4, d);
0104 %! Dxy1 = stk_dist(x, y);
0105 %! Dxy2 = stk_dist(struct('a', x), struct('a', y));
0106 %! assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(Dxy1, Dxy2));
0107 
0108 %%
0109 % Test with some simple matrices
0110 
0111 %!shared x, y, z
0112 %! x = zeros(11, 5);
0113 %! y = zeros(13, 5);
0114 %! z = ones(7, 5);
0115 
0116 %!test
0117 %! Dx = stk_dist(x);
0118 %! assert(isequal(Dx, zeros(11)));
0119 
0120 %!test
0121 %! Dxx = stk_dist(x, x);
0122 %! assert(isequal(Dxx, zeros(11)));
0123 
0124 %!test
0125 %! Dxy = stk_dist(x, y);
0126 %! assert(isequal(Dxy, zeros(11, 13)));
0127 
0128 %!test
0129 %! Dzz = stk_dist(z, z);
0130 %! assert(isequal(Dzz, zeros(7)));
0131 
0132 %!test
0133 %! Dxz = stk_dist(x, z);
0134 %! assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(Dxz, sqrt(5)*ones(11, 7)));
0135 
0136 %!test
0137 %! x = randn(5,3);
0138 %! y = randn(5,3);
0139 %! D1 = stk_dist(x, y, true); % pairwise
0140 %! D2 = stk_dist(x, y);
0141 %! assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(D1, diag(D2)));
0142 
0143 %!test
0144 %! x = randn(5,3);
0145 %! D1 = stk_dist(x, [], true); % pairwise
0146 %! assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(D1, zeros(5, 1)));
0147 %! D1 = stk_dist(x, x, true); % pairwise
0148 %! assert(stk_isequal_tolabs(D1, zeros(5, 1)));
